ygData.subject: RE: Chain vs. snare
ygData.msgSnippet: I would imagine like most of our songs, the effectiveness of the song is relative to your level compared against that of the mobs.  I m only 22d level so
ygData.messageBody:
I would imagine like most of our songs, the effectiveness of the song is
relative to your level compared against that of the mobs. I'm only 22d
level so haven't had the chance to play with Chain yet.

I am currently fighting primarily in Unrest and Mistmoore. In Unrest, the
Lullably and Largos' Binding song are pretty reliable, especially if I equip
an instrument. I don't get many resists when I play those two songs. In
Mistmoore, the creatures there seem to resist those two songs more
frequently, especially Largo's. I assume that is because the creatures in
Mistmoore are higher level than those in Unrest.

When I get Chain at level 23, will it be consistently effective/reliable if
I use it against creatures that con yellow and red to me? Based on my prior
experience, I would assume the answer is no.

Galtin of E'ci


> Huh? Chain is snare + it lessens the attackspeed of the mob.
> I don't get it. What do you think chain does?
>
> I will always override every snare/root I see with chains, much
> more effective for the party. Slower attacks and the effect of
> snare.
>
> If I chain something, it AINT moving.
>
>
